segments.text: I can't believe what I'm seeing; this kitchen is a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water is pouring out of the sink, and that woman doesn't even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is in the puddle, and she just keeps drying that plate like nothing's wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the kids are climbing on that stool, trying to get cookies without her seeing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm so worried someone is going to get hurt with all that water on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far; he could fall at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the girl is right there, waiting for a cookie, not realizing the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should say something, but I don't want to scare anyone.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Maybe I can just quietly turn off the faucet and help clean up the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope nothing bad happens before I can do something about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is really making me anxious; I need to act fast.
segments.speaker: PAR
